20101229155338.000|20101229155340.000|TR0|that with men, and I'm going to show you a 
20101229155340.000|20101229155343.000|TR0|picture of a hand that looks like this.  
20101229155343.000|20101229155345.000|TR0|With men, when the ring finger is longer 
20101229155345.000|20101229155348.000|TR0|than the index finger, they have a higher 
20101229155348.000|20101229155350.000|TR0|chance of getting prostate cancer later in 
20101229155350.000|20101229155353.000|TR0|life.  When the ring finger is longer than 
20101229155353.000|20101229155355.000|TR0|the index, a higher chance of getting 
20101229155355.000|20101229155358.000|TR0|prostate cancer later in life compared

20101229155400.000|20101229155403.000|TR0|configuration.

20101229155417.000|20101229155420.000|TR0|COHEN:  Well, let's talk a little bit 
20101229155420.000|20101229155422.000|TR0|about why this might true because it is 
20101229155422.000|20101229155425.000|TR0|kind of a bizarre finding.  Here's what we 
20101229155425.000|20101229155427.000|TR0|know about prostate cancer.  What we know 
20101229155427.000|20101229155430.000|TR0|is that men who have high levels of 
20101229155430.000|20101229155432.000|TR0|testosterone in their body have a higher 
20101229155432.000|20101229155435.000|TR0|chance of getting prostate cancer during 
20101229155435.000|20101229155437.000|TR0|their lifetime.

20101229155442.000|20101229155445.000|TR0|length of your fingers isn't random.  It 
20101229155445.000|20101229155447.000|TR0|has to do with how much testosterone you 
20101229155447.000|20101229155450.000|TR0|are exposed to in the womb.  Women, moms 
20101229155450.000|20101229155452.000|TR0|have testosterone in their bodies.  Their 
20101229155452.000|20101229155454.000|TR0|fetuses are to that testosterone and 
20101229155454.000|20101229155457.000|TR0|little boys who are in the womb, when they 
20101229155457.000|20101229155459.000|TR0|are exposed to more testosterone might 
20101229155459.000|20101229155502.000|TR0|tend to develop this ring bigger than - 
20101229155502.000|20101229155504.000|TR0|ring finger - the index finger 
20101229155504.000|20101229155507.000|TR0|configuration.
20101229155507.000|20101229155509.000|TR0|
20101229155509.000|20101229155512.000|TR0|To put it simply, lots of testosterone 
20101229155512.000|20101229155514.000|TR0|seems bad for prostate cancer and lots of 
20101229155514.000|20101229155517.000|TR0|testosterone also seems to influence your 
20101229155517.000|20101229155519.000|TR0|finger length. That's the theory.  Now you 
20101229155519.000|20101229155522.000|TR0|asked also, Alina, about what you can do 
20101229155522.000|20101229155524.000|TR0|with this.
20101229155524.000|20101229155527.000|TR0|
20101229155527.000|20101229155529.000|TR0|You know what?  This is just sort of
